message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.NE 

The paper deals with the application of deep convolutional neural networks (CNN) for left ventricular segmentation in myocardial arterial spin labeled (ASL) perfusion imaging. This falls under the computer vision (cs.CV) and machine learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. The paper also discusses the development of methods that measure uncertainty and adapt segmentation based on a specific false positive vs. false negative tradeoff, which falls under the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. The use of quantitative myocardial blood flow (MBF) maps and the Tversky loss function also suggest a potential fit for the multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category. Finally, the use of Monte Carlo (MC) dropout in the modified UNET architecture suggests a potential fit for the neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE) sub-category.
